TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
21 Matheu.
SEint Matheu þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; apo&slong;tel he was and is
Ewangeli&slong;t and eke apo&slong;tle &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe he was and is
Ewangeli&slong;t fo&rrot; he godspelles made &punctelev; þat men doth ofte rede
Apo&slong;tel fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd here on vrþe &punctelev; seint Matheu with him gan lede
Fo&rrot; ase o&rrot;e louerd eode ouer lond &punctelev; seint Matheu he saiȝ bi cas
his me&slong;ter don of walkingue &punctelev; fo&rrot; a follare he was
Fals and tricho&rrot; of is werk &punctelev; and liuede bi falshede
Ore louerd him hiet bileue is weo&rrot;k &punctelev; cum siwe me he seide
And he bilefde þo is weo&rrot;k &punctelev; and wiz o&rrot;e louerd eode
And is false me&slong;ter liet &punctelev; fo&rrot; he nadde þerto non neode
¶Fair fo&rrot;ebisne o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf &punctelev; alle sunfole men þo
&YOGH;wane he ane so sunfole Man &punctelev; het with him go
Seint Matheu is sunnes bette &punctelev; and tok to cri&slong;tindom
And siwede o&rrot;e louerd swiþe fa&slong;te &punctelev; and is Apo&slong;tel bicom.
Sethþe þo o&rrot;e louerd was into &punctelev; heouene iwend
Þe Apo&slong;tles weren þo wel wide in londe &punctelev; fo&rrot;to p&rrot;echie, isend
Into þe londe of Ethiope &punctelev; seint Matheu sone ȝede
to p&rrot;echie men to cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; ase it was wel gret neode
¶He founde tweie luþere men &punctelev; and &slong;trongue wichchene þere
Zaroen and Arphaxat &punctelev; þat þe deueles limes were
Þat, ase hu&ydot; wolden, in grete siknesse &punctelev; manie men hadden ido
And manie men þo&rrot;uȝ þe feonde &punctelev; ihelde hu&ydot; hadden also
Alle þat þe luþere men &punctelev; in siknesse b&rrot;ouȝte
Seint Matheu heom helde anon &punctelev; and wel clene heom out souȝte
So&rrot;ie weren þis luþere Men &punctelev; hu&ydot; nu&slong;ten ȝwat was to done
Tweie d&rrot;agones, þat feondes weren &punctelev; to heom hu&ydot; cleopeden sone
Þat ca&slong;ten b&rrot;um&slong;ton and fu&ydot;r &punctelev; and
slowe ȝend al þe londe
Mannes men and be&slong;tes þerewith wel þicke &punctelev; heom ne miȝhte no þing at|&slong;tonde
¶Þis luþere men nomen þe d&rrot;agones to heom &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; scholden to|d&rrot;awe
Þane Apo&slong;tel seint Seint Matheu &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue him of lijfdawe
Þo seint Seint Matheu þis iheo&rrot;de &punctelev; baldeliche he gan gon
Þe signe he made of þe croiz &punctelev; and to heom wende anon
Anon so þe d&rrot;agones him iseiȝen &punctelev; to is fet hu&ydot; fullen adoun
hu&ydot; ne miȝhten heom wawien hider ne þuder &punctelev; ane fot fo&rrot; al þe toun
"lo, ȝe wrechches," quath þe apo&slong;tle &punctelev; to þe luþere men tweie
&YOGH;ware is nouþe al eouwere miȝhte? &punctelev; ouercome ȝe beothþ beine
¶&YOGH;if inadde nouþe mine louerdes grace &punctelev; fo&rrot; eou ȝeo&rrot;ne bisouȝt
On eovsulf it scholde nouþe bifalle &punctelev; ase ȝe hadden bi me iþouȝt
Þis twei luþere d&rrot;agones &punctelev; þat ȝe habbuth hidere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Arereth heom ȝif ȝe mowen &punctelev; oþur eower art nis nouȝt
¶Euere &slong;toden þis wrechche men &punctelev; riȝht ase hu&ydot; weren inome
hu&ydot; weren of seint Seint Matheu aferde so&rrot;e &punctelev; and heolden heom ouercome
Seint Matheu þis tweie d&rrot;agones &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ Iesu cri&slong;tes lo&rrot;e
Out of þe londe heom d&rrot;of anon &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ne comen þere nonmo&rrot;e
he wende aboute and p&rrot;echede &punctelev; and þe tweie schrewene liet go
Ouercomene wrechches ase hui weren &punctelev; nas heom neuer er so wo
¶Hit bifeol þat þe kingues sone &punctelev; of þe londe was ded
Sone þis tweiȝe deoueles limes &punctelev; togadere nomen ho&rrot;e red
And wenden þudere ȝif hu&ydot; miȝhten &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e art him[orig. heom] arere
And hu&ydot; maden heo&rrot;e enchauntement &punctelev; ase þe deuel heom gan lere
Ake þat child lai euere ded &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e miȝhte nas riȝth nouȝt
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe kingue hu&ydot; weren inome &punctelev; and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;isone ib&rrot;ouȝt
¶Þe king sende aftur seint Seint Matheu &punctelev; ase men of him tolde
&YOGH;if he miȝhte is sone arere— &punctelev; fo&rrot; he was so wis iholde
Þo seint Seint Matheu þudere cam &punctelev; to o&rrot;e louerd heo he dude is bone
And arerde þat child &punctelev; fram deþe to liue wel sone
Þat child aros and herede god God &punctelev; ibo&rrot;e of ma&ydot;de marie
Anon so þe king þis iseiȝ &punctelev; wel loude he gan to crie
Fo&rrot;soþe he seide ich iseo &punctelev; þat Matheu a god God is
Þei he beo here in mannes fourme &punctelev; he is a god God , iwis
¶Anoure we him ase it is riȝht &punctelev; with seluer and with golde
hu&ydot; offreden to him treso&rrot; inouȝ &punctelev; mo&rrot;e þane he afongue wolde
Nai certes quath þis holie man &punctelev; god God nam ich nouȝt
Ake godes Godes seriaunt þat here on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; to deþe was ib&rrot;ouȝt
hoso wole on him bilieue &punctelev; to heouene he schal iwiende
And hoso nele nouȝt, he wo&rrot;th iwis &punctelev; in pine withþouten ende."
So þat þe king and alle his &punctelev; icri&slong;tnede of him were
With þe treso&rrot; þat men him b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; a fair churche he liet arere
¶In þritti dawes heo was arerd— &punctelev; so gret hel[p] þare was to
Þare þe king and is heo&rrot;e beden bede &punctelev; and alþe contreiȝe also
Aftur þe treiȝe tueiȝe enchauntours &punctelev; seint Matheu liet sende
Zaroes and Arphaxat &punctelev; and made heom þannes wiende
Into þe londe of perce &punctelev; hu&ydot; wenden with schame inov
Þere þat folk misbileued &punctelev; wel þicke aboute heom d&rrot;ov
¶Sethþe seint Seint
s&ydot;mon Symon and seint Seint Iude &punctelev; to perce þene wei nome
And þulke two enchauntours &punctelev; to grounde hu&ydot; ouercome
Þare hu&ydot; neuereft cri&slong;tine Men &punctelev; non anu&ydot; ne wrouȝte
Ase Man mai in heo&rrot;e liue iseo &punctelev; hoso þareafter souȝte
Seint Matheu in Ethiope &punctelev; þe kingues douȝter nam
Þat of hireseolf was a clene þing &punctelev; and ȝaf hire cri&slong;tinedom
A[r. and?] made hire auouwe cha&slong;tete &punctelev; and clene lif to lede
þat maide was wel apaid euereafturward &punctelev; of þat ilke dede
¶A king of an oþur londe &punctelev; is loue on hire he ca&slong;te
And wolde ire habbe to his spouse &punctelev; and wowede hire wel fa&slong;te
Þo þis maide nolde is wille do &punctelev; to seint Seint Matheu he ȝeode
Þat he scholde in his half beo &punctelev; and bed him grete mede
¶Cum quath seint Seint Matheu þilke dai &punctelev; and ich hire wolle rede
Þat heo heolde hire spoushod &punctelev; and þareinne hire lijf lede
Þe king was glad and wende wel &punctelev; Þat he bi him it seide
Þat he wolde hire to him rede— &punctelev; ake he nolde nouȝt don so to quede
Þe king cam ada&ydot; and muche folk &punctelev; with him he gan b&rrot;ingue
And þis maide cam also &punctelev; to hure seint Seint Matheus p&rrot;echingue
Seint Matheu &slong;tod and p&rrot;echede &punctelev; þat folk al ab&rrot;od
Me&slong;t he p&rrot;eisede of alle þingue &punctelev; in is sarmun spoushod
And þat þere nas no lijf so guod &punctelev; þare it was trewe and clene
Þe k&ydot;ng was glad and hopede wel &punctelev; þat he it dude bi him mene
Fo&rrot; þat Maide scholde &punctelev; to him iwedded beo
Seint Matheu he louede muche &punctelev; and hopede is wille iseo
¶So þat sethþe seint Seint Matheu &punctelev; is p&rrot;echingue fo&rrot;þere d&rrot;ouȝ
And seide ȝif þe king hadde a wif &punctelev; þat he louede inouȝ
And a fol come in spousb&rrot;uche &punctelev; and leiȝe bi is wiue
Þe king wolde beo wroth inouȝ &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingue him of liue
Fo&rrot; he him hadde is wijf binome &punctelev; and imad hire don amis
Of þe heiȝe king of heouene &punctelev; also it fareth iwis
&YOGH;if he hathþ a guod spouse &punctelev; þat ledeth clene lijf
And þare come fo&rrot;thþ a fol &punctelev; and binime him is wijf
To &slong;trongue deþe he wolde him b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; and to þe pine of helle also
Þarefo&rrot;e ech man beo iwar &punctelev; þat he swuch þing ne do."
¶Þo þe kin[g] iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; sone he onder&slong;tod
Þat it was riȝht bi him iseid. &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathþe he was neiȝh wod
And swo&rrot; þat he nolde bliþe beo &punctelev; are he were[MS. he were a were] awreke
Fo&rrot;[th][MS. fo&rrot;] he wende and bigan anon &punctelev; seint Matheus dethþ bispeke
Þis guode man nas noþing aferd &punctelev; he p&rrot;echede euere fa&slong;te
And confo&rrot;tede þat clene maide &punctelev; þat ire heo&rrot;te opon him al ca&slong;te
¶Þis Maide feol doun to is fet &punctelev; and on him ȝeo&rrot;ne gradde
Euere þis guode man hire bisouȝte &punctelev; þat heo clene lijf ladde
Sethþe he wende and greiþede him &punctelev; is masse fo&rrot;to singue
luþere Men iredie weren &punctelev; isende þo&rrot;uȝ þe kingue
Riȝht ase he &slong;tod at is Masse &punctelev; on of heom fo&rrot;thþ wende
And smot him þo&rrot;uout with a swerd &punctelev; and alle his gottes torende
Fo&rrot; he smot him In atþe Rugge &punctelev; and atþe wombe out
Þo þe guode Man aslawe was &punctelev; þe schrewe was wel p&rrot;out
¶Þat folk þat cri&slong;tine was &punctelev; wel þicke it cam anon
Þe kingues paleis fo&rrot;to b&rrot;enne &punctelev; and to aquelle is men echon
Ake seint Seint Matheus desciples &punctelev; fo&rrot;boden heom echone
Þat hu&ydot; ne duden no such þing &punctelev; ake lieten god God wurþe alone
hu&ydot; wenden and nomen þis holie bodi &punctelev; and swiþe faire on eo&rrot;þe it b&rrot;ouȝte.
Þe king ȝu&ydot;t bi al is miȝte &punctelev; after þat maide ȝeo&rrot;ne souȝte
Ake þo he ne miȝhte in none manere &punctelev; to is wille hire iwinne
he wende fo&rrot;th and sette afu&ydot;&rrot;e &punctelev; þat hous þat heo was inne
Ake seint Seint Matheu ne fo&rrot;ȝat nouȝt þat Maide &punctelev; þei he ded were :[orig. were ded]
Fram heouene he aliȝhte adoun to hire &punctelev; and is help ire cudde þere[added]
Fo&rrot; þat fu&ydot;r he d&rrot;of aȝein &punctelev; to þe kingues paleis anon
And furb&rrot;ende it alto nouȝt &punctelev; and is Men echon
¶Vnneþe he himsulf and is sone &punctelev; ascapeden with heo&rrot;e liue
he miȝhte segge, to wroþerhele &punctelev; he wilne[de] aftur wiue
Fo&rrot; su&ydot;þe sone þareafturward &punctelev; Musel he bicam
And þo he ne miȝhte nouȝt beo hol &punctelev; gret deol to him hee nam
With is swerd himsulf he aslouȝ &punctelev; and is bodi altorende
Nou god God it wot and seint Seint Matheu &punctelev; ȝwodere is soule wende
Þat folk wende fo&rrot;th anon &punctelev; and made ane newe king wel bliue
Þe clene maidenes b&rrot;oþur iwis &punctelev; þat he wilnede so muche to wiue
Þat seint Seint Matheu þe apo&slong;tel hadde &punctelev; icri&slong;tned with is honde
&YOGH;wareþo&rrot;u cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; cam sethþe into al þe londe
Nou Iesu cri&slong;t Cri&slong;t us ȝiue is grace &punctelev; þulke Io&ydot;ȝe ioyȝe iwinne
Fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Seint Matheu &punctelev; þat he woneth inne
